results.summary: A man charged with murdering two Big Issue sellers in Birmingham appears at the city's crown court.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/2472cfec-f4c2-4c4c-9d17-49e9b14e8820"><image id="65251617"/><paragraph role="introduction">A man charged with murdering two Big Issue sellers who were stabbed in the centre of Birmingham has appeared at the city's crown court.</paragraph><paragraph>John Ward, 23, of no fixed address, was remanded in custody until his next court appearance in April.</paragraph><paragraph>Wayne Busst, 32, and Ian Gladwish, 31, both from the city, were stabbed in Union Street shortly before 18:00 GMT on Friday.</paragraph><paragraph>Despite first aid from passers-by and police officers they died at the scene.</paragraph><paragraph>One of the men was stabbed outside Sainsbury's in Union Street, while the other was found slumped nearby outside a side entrance to Boots.</paragraph><paragraph>Police had said there could have been hundreds of witnesses to the stabbings.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/2472cfec-f4c2-4c4c-9d17-49e9b14e8820"><paragraph>A man charged with murdering two Big Issue sellers who were stabbed in the centre of Birmingham has appeared at the city's crown court.</paragraph><paragraph>John Ward, 23, of no fixed address, was remanded in custody until his next court appearance in April.</paragraph><paragraph>Wayne Busst, 32, and Ian Gladwish, 31, both from the city, were stabbed in Union Street shortly before 18:00 GMT on Friday.</paragraph><paragraph>Despite first aid from passers-by and police officers they died at the scene.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

65238044.caption: West Midlands Police have cordoned off part of Martineau Place and Union Street

65250387.caption: Union Street was cordoned off on Friday night after the stabbings
65250387.altText: Union Street closed on Friday night

65241081.caption: Supt Richard Moore said it was important not "to jump to conclusions"

65241510.caption: Extra police patrols were put on in the city centre over the weekend
65241510.altText: The front of Sainsbury's in Union Street on Saturday morning

65251617.caption: Wayne Busst and Ian Gladwish were Big Issue sellers
65251617.altText: Wayne Lee Busst (left) and Ian Watson Gladwish (right)

65251619.caption: Wayne Busst and Ian Gladwish had both been Big Issue sellers
65251619.altText: Wayne Lee Busst (left) and Ian Watson Gladwish (right)

items.summary: A 23-year-old man charged with murdering two Big Issue sellers who were stabbed in the centre of Birmingham is remanded in custody.
items.headline: Birmingham stabbings: Man in court over Big Issue deaths
items.shortHeadline: Murder charges over Big Issue men
